body: @bric3 I reckon it's the Nexus plugin that we need to update (that is stuck atm on the `-rc.2` upgrade) that will fix this. I don't see 5.15.0 available in https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/mockito/mockito-core/ indeed, whereas normally it would appear. Can you please take a look?

We are continuing the investigation. The bump of the Nexus plugin didn't fix the issue. On the staging repository, I now discovered that we have a failed rule regarding JavaDoc publication:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/790ab8e9-ec3c-43f3-9c17-1dde01f4741d)
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bf02b26f-40ca-4e0d-b9b6-971481d9c86a)

Could potentially be a result of https://github.com/mockito/mockito/commit/590b24a7fa821750fe19b848c2ee73de2c000ca9 by @bric3 but not sure yet

issue.title: Fix javadoc publication

repository.name: mockito
repository.description: Most popular Mocking framework for unit tests written in Java

https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/mockito/mockito-core/5.15.2/ is now available. Release job still failed (https://github.com/mockito/mockito/actions/runs/12586842018/job/35081960245) but I think that error can be ignored:

> Staging repository is not in desired state [released, not_found]: StagingRepository(id=orgmockito-1135, state=closed, transitioning=false). It is unexpected. Please check the Nexus logs using its web interface - it can be caused by validation rules violation (e.g. publishing artifacts with the same version again). If not, please report it to https://github.com/gradle-nexus/publish-plugin/issues/ with the '--info' logs.

issue.body:

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
